panels.description: Current Epoch
panels.title: Epoch

panels.description:
Epoch progression (%) - Calculated ratio of elapsed slots to total slots in current epoch.

1 Epoch is approx. 2 days or 432,000 slots.
panels.title: Epoch progression

panels.description: Estimated hours remaining in current epoch (based on 400ms target slot time)
panels.title: Epoch time left

panels.description:
From CoinGeko via API:
https://api.coingecko.com/api/v3/simple/price?ids=solana&vs_currencies=usd
panels.title: SOL / USD

panels.description: Currently not part of the exporter, will need to fix.
panels.title: Commission

panels.description: Current version of JITO MEV-Boost software running on validator.
panels.title: JITO Version

panels.description:
Time since last system boot. Tracks server stability and maintenance cycles.

• <7 days: Recent reboot or maintenance
• >90 days: Consider checking for kernel updates

Unexpected drops indicate system crashes or power events.
panels.title: Uptime

panels.description: Real-time validator health monitoring displaying operational status, network participation (delinquency), and blockchain synchronization (slots behind). All indicators should be green for optimal validator performance and rewards.
panels.title: Health check

panels.description: Total credits accumulated in current epoch. Resets to zero at epoch boundaries.
panels.title: Current Epoch Credits

panels.description:
Delegator Stakes Overview (1h refresh)
Shows active delegations to this validator, including:
- Owner's wallet that controls the stake
- Amount of SOL delegated via unique stake accounts
- Withdrawal permissions (may differ from owner for security)
panels.title: Delegators

panels.description: Credits earned per hour - stable rate indicates consistent voting performance.
panels.title: Validator Credit Earning Rate

panels.description: Total SOL currently staked to validator - directly affects voting weight and rewards.
panels.title: Active Stake

panels.description:
Credits earned per 1000 SOL staked - measures validator performance efficiency relative to stake. Higher values indicate better reward generation potential.

validator_total_credits / active_stake

This efficiency metric normalizes credit earning by stake amount. Track this value over time - if it drops significantly while your skip rate remains stable, it could indicate network-wide changes or issues specific to your validator.

*Will look into adding network average for comparison
panels.title: Credit Earning Efficiency

panels.description:
Tracks leader slot assignment and execution for the current epoch. 

- Assigned slots represent the total scheduled for this validator: allocated proportionally as [Stake ÷ Total Network Stake × 432,000 Slots] 
- Processed slots are successfully produced blocks
- Skipped slots are missed opportunities. 

Slots are assigned in groups of 4 consecutive slots; stake percentage can be estimated as [Assigned Slots ÷ 432,000 × 100].

Skip Rates: The lines track the percentage of missed slots for this validator (red) vs. the entire cluster (white). Gaps represent periods when no leader slots were scheduled.

*Bug to fix. Data persistency after exporter restart (causing the decrease in value as counter starts from 0 again)

matcher.options: Assigned leader slots for this Epoch

panels.title: Leader Slot Performance

panels.description:
- Identity Account: Operational account that pays for vote transaction fees (~0.01 SOL/day) and receives priority fees when producing blocks as leader. Should maintain >10 SOL for continued operation.
- Vote Account: Accumulates commission earnings from delegator rewards based on commission rate. If commission is set to 100%, all rewards go here instead of  delegator's stake account. Rewards are paid out at the beginning of each new epoch.
- Stake Account(s): Where delegated SOL are held and individual staking rewards accumulate.
- Withdrawer account: Has authority to move accumulated commission from Vote account. Kept offline for security.
- Key Metrics: Monitor identity for operational funds, vote account for accumulated commission, and stake accounts for delegation status. Commission settings directly impact reward distribution.
panels.title: Validator Account Balances (SOL)

panels.description:
Vote Distance (current_slot - last_vote_slot)
- Measures how quickly the validator votes on new blocks
- Ideal range: 1-5 slots (lower is better)
- Consistent low values show the validator is keeping up with the network
- High values (>10) may indicate network connectivity issues or validator performance problems

Root Distance (last_vote_slot - root_slot)
- Tracks the gap between latest votes and confirmed immutable blocks (roots)
- Normal range: ~20-50 slots depending on network conditions
- Directly related to the validator's tower height - a stability mechanism tracking consecutive votes

Tower Height is the count of consecutive votes the validator has made, which increases lockout periods and creates finality. A healthy tower produces stable root distance values, while tower rebuilds can cause sudden root distance changes.

Correlation between spikes in both metrics often indicates network-wide events, while divergence may point to validator-specific issues.
panels.title: Vote & Root distance

panels.description:
Combined rate of swap operations (pages/sec). For Solana validators, this should ALWAYS be zero.

Any non-zero value indicates memory pressure that can severely impact validator performance.
panels.title: Swap activity

panels.description:
Critical hardware temperatures. NVMe drives perform best below 50°C.
This CPU is designed to run at 95°C 24/7 as confirmed by Fiberstate and AMD.
panels.title: Temperatures

panels.description:
Acounts drive (nvme1n1) operations and utilization. Stores validator account data with periodic verification spikes.

Key Metrics:
- Write IOPS: Typically low (5-30 IOPS), spikes during updates
- Read IOPS: Regular spikes every ~3h for verification are normal
- Disk Utilization: Low (<1%) with headroom for growth

Warning Signs:
- Missing scheduled read verification spikes
- Disk Utilization >50% sustained
- Unusual write activity patterns
panels.title: Accounts Drive (nvme0n1) IOPS - Usage

panels.description:
Ledger drive (nvme0n1) operations and utilization. Stores blockchain history with continuous write activity.

Key Metrics:
- Write IOPS: Steady 300-600 range for healthy validator
- Read IOPS: Variable 5-100 based on RPC activity
- Disk Utilization: ~10-15% is normal, grows over time

Warning Signs:
- Write IOPS dropping below 300 for extended periods
- Disk Utilization >70% sustained
- Latency increases during high throughput
panels.title: Ledger drive (nvme1n1) IOPS + Usage

panels.description:
OS/Snapshots drive (nvme2n1) operations and utilization. Contains system, swap, and snapshot data.

Key Metrics:
- Write IOPS: Spikes during snapshot downloads/system updates
- Read IOPS: Variable based on system activity
- Disk Utilization: Low utilization with occasional spikes

Warning Signs:
- Sustained high disk utilization >50%
- Continuous high I/O outside snapshot operations
- Low free space on critical partitions
panels.title: OS/Snapshots drive (nvme2n1) IOPS + Usage

panels.description:
System load averages represent CPU demand (running + waiting processes).
   
- 1-minute avg: Immediate system pressure
- 5-minute avg: Short-term trends
- 15-minute avg: Sustained system pressure
   
For this 32-thread CPU:
- Below 24: Normal operation
- 24-32: High utilization but within capacity
- Above 32: System under pressure, potential performance impact.
panels.title: CPU Load

panels.description:
Percentage of CPU time spent waiting for disk operations. High values indicate storage bottlenecks that can impact validator performance.
   
- 0-5%: Healthy operation
- 5-10%: Moderate disk pressure
- Above 10%: Significant disk bottleneck
   
Spikes during leader slots are normal, but sustained high values require investigation.

targets.legendFormat: I/O Wait percentage across all CPU cores

panels.title: I/O Wait percentage across all CPU cores

panels.description:
Current number of open file descriptors. Solana validators typically use thousands of file handles.

Default Linux soft limit: ~65,536

Monitor for steady growth which may indicate resource leaks.
panels.title: File Descriptors

panels.description:
Current network throughput. Solana validators typically see spikes during leader slots.

Key Metrics:
- Current Transmit/Receive: Real-time network usage
- Warning Signs: Sustained high utilization or unexpected drops
panels.title: Current Network Bandwidth in Mega Bytes

panels.description:
Shows actual packet counts with issues. For reference:
- Normal: 0-10 drops per 5min (negligible impact)
- Concerning: >100 drops per 5min (investigate if persistent)
- Critical: >1000 drops per 5min (immediate investigation needed)
panels.title: Network Quality

panels.description:
Network data usage metrics for capacity planning. Solana validators typically transfer 30-100TB per month depending on network activity.

Key Insights:
- Daily usage provides early warning of traffic spikes
- Monthly usage helps track datacenter bandwidth limits
- Receive/transmit ratio should typically be ~1.5:1

The current max per month is 330TB for this server.
panels.title: Data consumption in Terra Bytes
